Authors: Meiryani, Aji A.B., Hendratno S.P., Phumdara T.
Title: The impact of electronic toll (E-toll) systems implementation on the reporting quality of accounting information
Affiliations: Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; College of Innovation and Management, Suan Sunandha Rajabhat Univeristy, Bangkok, Thailand
Authors with affiliations: Meiryani, Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Aji, A.B., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hendratno, S.P., Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Phumdara, T., College of Innovation and Management, Suan Sunandha Rajabhat Univeristy, Bangkok, Thailand
Abstract: The implementation of Systems Electronic Toll (E-Toll) is a development of the internal control structure due to the growing business scope. The background of this research was to determine how the impact of the E-Toll implementation of each variable reader machine tap e-Toll, settlement monitoring tools, bank server, dan R/K bank on the reporting quality of accounting information produced. This study aims to determine the impact of E-Toll implementation on the performance and level of user satisfaction. The method used in this research is quantitative analysis by describing the data obtained from the questionnaire of the employee. The results of this study stated that the e-Toll reader tap machine, settlement monitoring tools, bank servers, and R/C banks had a positive impact on the reporting quality accounting information. © 2019 by Advance Scientific Research. This is an open-access article under the CC BY license (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/)
Author Keywords: Accounting; Bank Server; E-Toll; Information; Machine Tap; Quality; Reporting; Settlement Monitoring; Tools
Funding Text 1: This work is supported by Binus University, Jakarta, Indonesia.
